docs.snippet: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, June 21 -- The United States agreed today to work through a special inter-American committee to establish "new bases and instruments of action" for economic cooperation with Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, June 21 -- The United States agreed today to work through a special inter-American committee to establish "new bases and instruments of action" for economic cooperation with Latin America.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 22 -- Governor Rockefeller ended the third of his four fact-finding trips in Latin America for President Nixon today. He said he was heartened by the trip and hopeful that he could still visit the three nations that had...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 22 -- Governor Rockefeller ended the third of his four fact-finding trips in Latin America for President Nixon today. He said he was heartened by the trip and hopeful that he could still visit the three nations that had asked him to stay away.
docs.abstract: Rockefeller coms with Pres Pacheco, Punta del Este; visit seen as victory for Pacheco, who was determined to have Rockefeller come despite calls in Parliament that trip be postponed; small groups of anti-US demonstrators clash with police, Montevideo; Rockefeller returns to NY

headline.main: Rockefeller Ends Third Latin Trip; He Is 'Heartened'; Rockefeller Leaves Uruguay, Ending 3d Leg of Latin Mission

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, June 24 -- The Peruvian Government announced today that it would expropriate all major tracts of privately owned land and divide them among the people. Included in these lands is property owned by such United States investors as W. R....
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, June 24 -- The Peruvian Government announced today that it would expropriate all major tracts of privately owned land and divide them among the people. Included in these lands is property owned by such United States investors as W. R. Grace Co. and a company controlled by Governor Rockefeller and members of his family.
docs.abstract: Pres Velasco Alvarado says Govt will expropriate all major privately-owned land tracts and divide land among people, TV s; pledges 'just compensation' for all landholders; some US cos will lose property

headline.main: PERU WILL SEIZE ALL BIG HOLDINGS FOR LAND REFORM; 'Just Compensation' Vowed by Regime -- Rockefeller Interests Involved PERU WILL SEIZE ALL BIG HOLDINGS

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 24 -- Faced with a new wave of disabling strikes and a move in Congress to impeach him, President Jorge Pacheco Areco decreed a limited state of siege today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 24 -- Faced with a new wave of disabling strikes and a move in Congress to impeach him, President Jorge Pacheco Areco decreed a limited state of siege today.
docs.abstract: Pres Pacheco decrees ltd state of siege in face of new wave of strikes and Cong moves to Impeach him; troops patrol Montevideo to maintain order and secure 'militarization' of pub services; Govt is empowered to make arrests and detain prisoners without ct orders; Natl Confederation of Labor leaders, most of whom are Communist party members, reptdly arrested; unions close 8 daily newspapers in support of left-wing newspaper Extra, closed by Govt; current strike at meat-packing plant, main source of export earnings, revd

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BRAZIL and the Brazil Kennel Club will celebrate a dual anniversary in 1972. The nation will mark the 150th year of its independence, the kennel club the 50th year of its founding.

headline.main: Dog Fanciers of World Invited For Brazil's Anniversary Year

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 27 -- Two Central American neighbors -- Salvador and Honduras -- have broken relations in a dispute brought to a head by recent rivalry over soccer.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 27 -- Two Central American neighbors -- Salvador and Honduras -- have broken relations in a dispute brought to a head by recent rivalry over soccer.
docs.abstract: Salvador and Honduras break ties in dispute, brought to head by recent soccer rivalry; details; map; each nation charges other with violation of human rights and calls on OAS to back its case

headline.main: Salvador and Honduras Cut Tie; Soccer 'War' Sharpens Dispute; Salvador and Honduras, in Soccer Dispute, Cut Ties

docs.snippet: In Mexico next May and June, 16 nations will compete for soccer's World Cup, more correctly known as the Jules Rimet Trophy. So far, only three of these are definitely known: Mexico, the host, and England, the Cup holder, who qualify ex officio, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: In Mexico next May and June, 16 nations will compete for soccer's World Cup, more correctly known as the Jules Rimet Trophy. So far, only three of these are definitely known: Mexico, the host, and England, the Cup holder, who qualify ex officio, and Belgium, which has most swiftly and unexpectedly prevailed, in a powerful group that also included Spain and Yugoslavia.

headline.main: Preview of World Cup; The Groupings of Nations Into Zones Held to Favor South American Teams

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, June 30 -- Augusto Vandor, a former protege of Juan D. Peron, the exiled former dictator, had come under increasing criticism recently from leftist labor leaders for his friendliness to the military government of President Ongania.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, June 30 -- Augusto Vandor, a former protege of Juan D. Peron, the exiled former dictator, had come under increasing criticism recently from leftist labor leaders for his friendliness to the military government of President Ongania.

headline.main: Leftists Opposed Vandor; ARGENTINA ACTS TO CURB VIOLENCE

docs.snippet: If a capstone were needed for Nelson Rockefeller's gallant but ill-starred Latin-American mission, the photograph of a smiling Governor and a delighted President Duvalier, waving at the crowd from the balcony of Haiti's National Palace, supplied it....
docs.lead_paragraph: If a capstone were needed for Nelson Rockefeller's gallant but ill-starred Latin-American mission, the photograph of a smiling Governor and a delighted President Duvalier, waving at the crowd from the balcony of Haiti's National Palace, supplied it. That picture symbolized the political hazards for the United States in Mr. Rockefeller's "listen and learn" travels for President Nixon.
docs.abstract: ed on Rockefeller visit and illus of him with smiling Duvalier

docs.snippet: Governor Rockefeller returned to New York yesterday from the fourth and final leg of his fact-finding tour of Latin America for President Nixon and declared that the violent protests that surrounded his mission were symptomatic of an urgent need for...
docs.lead_paragraph: Governor Rockefeller returned to New York yesterday from the fourth and final leg of his fact-finding tour of Latin America for President Nixon and declared that the violent protests that surrounded his mission were symptomatic of an urgent need for change in the hemisphere.
docs.abstract: Rockefeller returns to NY from 4th and final Latin-Amer trip; illus; is met by New Left protest led by M Rudd; illus; says problems that developed during trip are clear evidence of need for change of US policies, news conf; declines to discuss what he will recommend in rept to Nixon, which he expects to submit in Aug, but says it will deal with proposals for hemisphere-wide changes in US policy; says trade relations are key source of difficulty; trip revd

headline.main: LATIN TOURS OVER, ROCKEFELLER URGES NEW U.S. POLICIES; Plans a Report to Nixon in August on Broad Range of Hemisphere Problems
